result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy S Nitek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Rusk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Monthly payments will be reduced to $50.00 per month for the next three months, then return to original payment amount.

DE will be allowed Huber.  DE will have 30 days to report to jail.
9-09-15-JOC amended to allow DE until 9-25-15 to report to jail.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement

Defendant Randy S Nitek in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on Plea questionnarie/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 1, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Ct's 2-3 will be DRI.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties,  will order 45 days jail, huber, CC.  Atty asking for 30 day stay for jail time so DE can arrange his affairs, apply bond to CC, reduce monthly payment to $50.00 for the next three months.
